perturbation.original_text:
1.01     CONTRACTORS.  Affiliate  shall  use its best efforts to market and sell
to  commercial businesses the Services of Network 1 and Network 1's subsidiaries
and  to  locate individuals who are willing and capable of acting as Contractors
of  Network  1  and Affiliate subject to the approval of all such individuals by
Network  1  as  set  out  in  Section  2.01  [CONTRACTORS].  All  such Contractors must process
Merchant applications and transactions exclusively through Network 1.  Network 1
consents  to  waive  said  exclusivity  requirement  with  respect  to  specific
Merchants  in  the  event  Network  1 (i) is unable to process for such specific
Merchant,  and  (ii)  the  declined Merchant is not accepted for processing by a
provider  that Network 1 designates for specific Merchant's that are declined by
Network  1  ("B  Bank  Source").  Affiliate  shall  disclose  to  Network  1 all
information  known  to  Affiliate  with  respect  to  the background, character,
employment  history,  business  experience  and other information regarding each
prospective  Contractor  relevant to Network 1's determination whether to accept
or  not  accept  each  prospective  Contractor.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.01     CONTRACTORS.  Affiliate  shall  use commercially reasonable efforts to market and sell
to  commercial businesses the Services of Network 1 and Network 1's subsidiaries
and  to  locate individuals who are willing and capable of acting as Contractors
of  Network  1  subject to the approval of all such individuals by Network 1. All  such Contractors must process Merchant applications and transactions primarily through Network 1, with the allowance to use other providers where Network 1 is demonstrably uncompetitive in pricing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires 'best efforts' from the Affiliate to market services and requires Contractors to process exclusively through Network 1. The modified text changes 'best efforts' to 'commercially reasonable efforts' making it less stringent, and replaces the exclusivity requirement with a clause allowing other providers if Network 1's pricing is uncompetitive, creating an ambiguity regarding how exclusivity is enforced.

perturbation.original_text:
2.01     CONTRACTORS.  Network  1  shall  have  the right, at its discretion, to
accept,  not accept, terminate or otherwise deal with any individuals located by
Affiliate  pursuant  to  Section  1.01  [CONTRACTORS].  All individuals identified by Affiliate
shall be subject to the rules imposed by Network 1, VISA, MasterCard, NACHA, and
the  Member bank ("Member") utilized by Network 1, including rules pertaining to
qualification  disqualification, conduct and otherwise, and shall agree to enter
into,  and  shall  in fact enter into, a three party Contractor Agreement in the
form  attached  hereto  as  Exhibit  1  as  amended  from  time  to  time.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.01     CONTRACTORS.  Network  1  shall  endeavor to accept individuals located by Affiliate pursuant to Section 1.01 [CONTRACTORS]. All individuals identified by Affiliate will be given preference to Network 1 contractor positions. All individuals identified by Affiliate
shall be subject to the rules imposed by Network 1, VISA, MasterCard, NACHA, and
the  Member bank ("Member") utilized by Network 1, including rules pertaining to
qualification  disqualification, conduct and otherwise, and shall agree to enter
into,  and  shall  in fact enter into, a three party Contractor Agreement in the
form  attached  hereto  as  Exhibit  1  as  amended  from  time  to  time.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original clause giving Network 1 absolute discretion to accept or reject contractors. Now it says Network 1 will 'endeavor to accept' and Contractors identified by Affiliate will be given 'preference'. This makes the approval process ambiguous; it is unclear how much discretion Network 1 retains, and what constitutes 'preference'.

perturbation.original_text:
5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for
successive  one-year  terms  unless  terminated by either party by providing the
other  with  30  days  written notice that this Agreement will not be renewed or
Affiliate  enters  into  a  Processing  agreement  with  Network  1  and  an ISO
Sponsorship  agreement  with  Harris  Bank  in  which  case  this Agreement will
automatically  terminate  concurrent  with  the  execution  of  such agreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for
successive  one-year  terms  unless  terminated by either party by providing the
other  with  30  days  written notice that this Agreement will not be renewed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Network 1 reserves the right to terminate the agreement at any time and for any reason with 30 days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause outlines specific conditions for automatic renewal or termination. The added sentence introduces a conflicting clause, stating Network 1 can terminate 'at any time and for any reason with 30 days written notice'. This contradicts the previous clauses specifying term length and renewal conditions, making it unclear under what circumstances Network 1 can actually terminate the agreement.
